channel.title: USB devices fingerprint
channel.description: I boot my linux OS where I have KVM Whonix. Then I start Gateway and Workstation and browse for a bit. Then I noticed that I forgot to unplug my USB Webcam. Is this a major problem ? I mean notebooks also have webcams but people use them for Whonix and KVM Whonix default settings doesn't mount USB devices so I think all it's okay while my host OS is not virused/hacked. Am I safe ?

item.title: USB devices fingerprint
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
No USB Devices get passed through on Debian by default nor do I have USB redirectors added. You have to go out of your way to have it work as per documentation.

Read full topic

item.title: USB devices fingerprint
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
I don’t think webcams are even in the default VM configuration.

Read full topic

item.title: USB devices fingerprint
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I have no reason to think that something very bad happened.

Read full topic
